text: It is a nice looking representation. Colorful, nicely indented, pleasing. But I don't think this visualization helps much in terms of understanding what a program does.. It is what a program does to the data that is its true meaning; an IF statement is nothing more than a fork in the road, whether you do A or B must matter somehow or the programmer wouldn't have put it in.  It is when, why and what happens, 3 of the "biggies" in journalism that is missing from the visualization, and i would suggest you augment the flow of the execution on top of this representation to get somewhere, and either show values or link to values.

text: It's very hard for me to parse what's going on, but this is coming from a guy who uses 24pt+ font.  I think the text doesn't stand out from the other formatting contextual information enough.  Less is more; I bet I'd like it more if you deemphasized syntactic cues and doubled down on semantic cues.
